headline: UK to roll out COVID-19 antiviral drug trial this month -Health Security Agency
text: LONDON, Nov 7 (Reuters) - Britain will start to roll out Merck's (MRK.N) molnupiravir COVID-19 antiviral pill through a drug trial later this month, Susan Hopkins, Chief Medical Adviser at the UK Health Security Agency said on Sunday.

headline: UK's Truss to visit southeast Asia to boost economic and security ties
text: LONDON, Nov 7 (Reuters) - British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss will travel to Malaysia on Sunday as part of a week-long visit to southeast Asia aimed at deepening economic and security ties in the region, her office said.

headline: UB40 founding member Astro dies after short illness
text: LONDON, Nov 7 (Reuters) - One of the founding members of British reggae band UB40, Terence Wilson, has died after a short illness, his band has announced.

headline: Big crowds rally in rainy Glasgow for COP26 climate action
text: GLASGOW, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Tens of thousands of protesters marched on Saturday through rainy downtown Glasgow, and in many other cities around the world, to demand bolder action at the U.N. climate conference.

headline: UK reports 155 new COVID deaths, 30,693 cases on Saturday
text: LONDON, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Britain reported 155 deaths on Saturday of people who had tested positive for COVID-19 within the past 28 days, and a further 30,693 new infections.

headline: Ex-British PM calls actions of Johnson's government "politically corrupt"
text: LONDON, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Former British Prime Minister John Major on Saturday attacked fellow Conservative Boris Johnson's handling of a corruption row, saying the government's behaviour was arrogant, broke the law and was "politically corrupt".

headline: EU warns Britain: Don't press the emergency Brexit button
text: LONDON/BRUSSELS, Nov 5 (Reuters) - The European Union said on Friday that Britain had made no move to seek a compromise on post-Brexit trade with Northern Ireland and cautioned London against triggering emergency unilateral provisions in the Brexit deal.

headline: Crunch time in Britain as even beloved crisps in short supply
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - In Britain, there is even a shortage of crunch.

headline: Gene linked to doubling risk of COVID-19 death found by UK scientists
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - British scientists have identified a version of a gene that may be associated with double the risk of lung failure from COVID-19, a finding that provides new insights into why some people are more susceptible than othersto severe illness and which opens possibilities for targeted medicine.

headline: Britain allows early booking of booster shots to speed up rollout
text: LONDON, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Britain's health ministry on Saturday said it would open up bookings for booster shots a month before people were eligible to receive the shots to help speed up the rollout ahead of the challenging winter months.

headline: After market mayhem, BoE officials say rate hike still on table
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Bank of England officials sought to reassure investors on Friday that they were sticking to plans to raise interest rates, a day after the central bank confounded widespread market expectations of a rate hike.

headline: Banks, energy shares lift FTSE 100; IAG jumps on recovery hopes
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - London's FTSE 100 ended higher on Friday, led by banks and energy stocks, while British Airways parent IAG jumped on recovery hopes despite warning of a big loss in 2021.

headline: England in semis despite South Africa loss, Australia through
text: SHARJAH, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Former champions England sailed into the semi-finals of the Twenty20 World Cup despite their 10-run loss to South Africa on Saturday with Ashes rivals Australia also making the last four from Group I.

headline: UK reports 193 new COVID deaths, 34,029 cases
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Britain reported 193 deaths on Friday of people who had tested positive for COVID-19 within the past 28 days, and an extra 34,029 cases.

headline: Yorkshire chairman quits, says club refused to learn from racism allegations
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - The chairman of Yorkshire County Cricket Club resigned on Friday, accusing the club's executives of failing to accept and learn from racism allegations raised by former player Azeem Rafiq over a year ago.

headline: Britain's Prince Charles to visit Barbados to mark republic's birth
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Prince Charles, heir to the British throne, will travel to Barbados to mark the Caribbean island's transition to a republic which entails the removal of Queen Elizabeth as head of state.

headline: Chelsea fan jailed for anti-Semitic tweets
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - A Chelsea supporter has been sentenced to eight weeks in jail by the Westminster Magistrates' Court for posting racist and anti-Semitic tweets.

headline: BA-owner IAG optimistic on transatlantic reopening despite 2021 losses
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - British Airways owner IAG (ICAG.L) is "very optimistic" about the reopening of transatlantic travel and planning to ramp up capacity on those routes next year, fuelling recovery hopes despite warning of a big loss in 2021.

headline: UK seeks long-term gas deal with Qatar, asks to become 'supplier of last resort’ -FT
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - The British government has approached Qatar to seek a long-term gas deal and shore up supplies as a natural gas shortage in Europe has led to soaring wholesale prices, the Financial Times reported on Friday.

headline: Twelve arrested after fleeing emergency plane landing in Mallorca
text: MADRID, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Police in Spain arrested 12 people and were looking for 12 more after a group of passengers fled a plane onto the runway at Palma de Mallorca airport on Friday night, causing the closure of the airport for several hours.

headline: Unvaccinated in Greece face new restrictions as COVID cases soar
text: ATHENS, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Queues formed outside shops in Athens on Saturday on the first day of new restrictions to curb soaring coronavirus infections which require the unvaccinated to have negative COVID-19 tests.

headline: Georgian protesters rally in support of jailed former president
text: MOSCOW, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Around 3,000 Georgian protesters held a rally in support of jailed former president Mikheil Saakashvili on Saturday outside the prison where he says he is on hunger strike.

headline: 'Her heart was beating too' - Poles protest against strict abortion law
text: WARSAW, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Thousands of people gathered in cities across Poland on Saturday to protest against strict abortion laws after a pregnant woman's death reignited public debate on the issue in one of Europe's most devoutly Catholic countries.

headline: UK to roll out COVID-19 antiviral drug trial this month -Health Security Agency
text: LONDON, Nov 7 (Reuters) - Britain will start to roll out Merck's (MRK.N) molnupiravir COVID-19 antiviral pill through a drug trial later this month, Susan Hopkins, Chief Medical Adviser at the UK Health Security Agency said on Sunday.

headline: Ex-British PM calls actions of Johnson's government "politically corrupt"
text: LONDON, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Former British Prime Minister John Major on Saturday attacked fellow Conservative Boris Johnson's handling of a corruption row, saying the government's behaviour was arrogant, broke the law and was "politically corrupt".

headline: Bosnia's disintegration would affect entire region, says peace envoy
text: BERLIN, Nov 6 (Reuters) - If a multi-ethnic Bosnia is pushed towards disintegration, that will inevitably have an impact on other unresolved conflicts in the Western Balkans such as that between Serbia and Kosovo, Bosnia's peace envoy told Reuters on Saturday.

headline: Death of pregnant woman ignites debate about abortion ban in Poland
text: WARSAW, Nov 5 (Reuters) - The death of a pregnant Polish woman has reignited debate over abortion in one of Europe's most devoutly Catholic countries, with activists saying she could still be alive if it were not for a near total ban on terminating pregnancies.

headline: As Spain pledges more La Palma aid, some islanders ask: where's the cash?
text: LA PALMA, Spain, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Spain will provide whatever is necessary for La Palma to recover from the destruction wrought by weeks of volcanic eruptions, its prime minster said on Thursday, as some residents said financial aid had been slow to arrive.

headline: Diplomat found dead outside Berlin embassy was Russian secret agent - Der Spiegel
text: BERLIN, Nov 5 (Reuters) - German security services believe that a man found dead in a street outside the Russian Embassy in Berlin last month was an undercover agent of Russia's FSB intelligence service, Der Spiegel reported on Friday.

headline: Macron's ex-bodyguard handed jail sentence over May Day assaults
text: PARIS, Nov 5 (Reuters) - A former security adviser to French President Emmanuel Macron was sentenced on Friday to three years in jail, two of them suspended, over charges including roughing up May Day protesters in 2018, media reported.

headline: France and Britain defuse fishing row with 'positive' talks
text: PARIS, Nov 4 (Reuters) - France and Britain moved to defuse their dispute over fishing on Thursday, with sanctions off the table for now but all options still possible should talks fail, French European Affairs Minister Clement Beaune said.

headline: Portugal's Socialists gain support ahead of snap election, poll shows
text: LISBON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Portugal's ruling Socialists lead the race to win an election in January with more votes than they took in 2019, but short of a full majority, according to the first poll of voting intentions taken since parliament rejected their budget last week.

headline: Austria bans the unvaccinated from restaurants as COVID-19 cases surge
text: VIENNA, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Austria said on Friday it is barring those not fully vaccinated against COVID-19 from cafes, restaurants and hairdressers as infections approach the record set a year ago and the government struggles to convince holdouts to get the shot.

headline: With fourth wave raging, Germany agrees booster shots for all
text: BERLIN, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Germany's COVID-19 situation is entering a very difficult period with rising numbers of intensive care patients, health minister Jens Spahn said, as German state leaders warned the country may need a new lockdown unless it takes urgent action.  read more

headline: France tightens bird flu measures as virus spreads in Europe
text: PARIS, Nov 5 (Reuters) - The French government has put the entire country on high alert for bird flu as the virus spreads across Europe, the agriculture ministry said on Friday.

headline: Croatia tightens measures to fight spreading of COVID-19
text: ZAGREB, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Amid new record-high COVID-19 daily infections Croatia decided on Friday to tighten measures against the spreading of the disease, including introducing obligatory digital certificates for public sector employees.

headline: COVID-19 tears through generation of unvaccinated Romanian elderly
text: GIURGIU, Romania, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Elderly patients gasping for air through oxygen masks in a central Romanian hospital struggled to explain why they had not been vaccinated despite easy access earlier in the coronavirus pandemic.

headline: Malta to offer COVID-19 booster shots to all its population
text: VALLETTA, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Malta will offer COVID-19 booster shots to all of its population after a recent increase in cases, Health Minister Chris Fearne said on Friday.

headline: China's Oct trade surplus with the United States at $40.75 bln
text: BEIJING, Nov 7 (Reuters) - China's trade surplus with the United States was $40.75 billion in October, Reuters calculations based on customs data showed on Sunday, down from $42 billion in September.

headline: China's crude oil imports in Oct fall to lowest in three years
text: BEIJING, Nov 7 (Reuters) - China's crude oil imports plunged in October to the lowest since September 2018, as large state-owned refiners withheld purchases because of rising prices while independent refiners were restrained by limited quotas to import.

headline: China's forex reserves rise in Oct for first time since July
text: BEIJING, Nov 7 (Reuters) - China's foreign exchange reserves in October rose on a monthly basis for the first time since July, official data showed on Sunday, as the dollar slipped against a basket of other major currencies.

headline: Biden's democracy summit: Problematic invite list casts shadow on impact
text: WASHINGTON, Nov 7 (Reuters) - President Joe Biden is getting ready to deliver on a key campaign promise by convening a Summit for Democracy: a first-of-its kind gathering of more than 100 countries to help stop democratic backsliding and erosion of rights and freedoms worldwide.

headline: China Oct exports beat forecasts, offer buffer to slowing domestic economy
text: BEIJING, Nov 7 (Reuters) - China's export growth slowed in October but beat forecasts, helped by booming global demand ahead of winter holiday seasons, an easing power crunch and an improvement in supply chains that had been badly disrupted by the coronavirus pandemic.

headline: China's Xinhua lauds Xi ahead of key Communist Party meeting
text: SHANGHAI, Nov 6 (Reuters) - China's state news agency Xinhua lauded President Xi Jinping on Saturday as a tireless, selfless and scholarly servant of the people, ahead of a key meeting of the ruling Communist Party that is expected to further cement his authority.

headline: Credit Suisse says it shut Ai Weiwei account due to missing paperwork
text: ZURICH, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Credit Suisse (CSGN.S) closed a bank account of dissident Chinese artist Ai Weiwei because of missing paperwork, it said on Saturday, responding to his accusation that the Swiss bank had shut him out as part of a strategy to win business in China.

headline: China spurs Taiwan anger with criminal liability threat for independence supporters
text: BEIJING, Nov 5 (Reuters) - China will hold those who support "Taiwan independence" criminally liable for life, it said on Friday, provoking anger and ridicule from the democratic island at a time of heightened tension across the sensitive Taiwan Strait.

headline: China has given 75.96% of population complete COVID-19 vaccine doses
text: BEIJING, Nov 6 (Reuters) - China had given 1.072 billion people complete COVID-19 vaccine doses by Nov. 5, Mi Feng, spokesman at the National Health Commission, told a briefing on Saturday.

headline: EXCLUSIVE New Hong Kong university classes set out dangers of breaking security law
text: HONG KONG, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Last month, several thousand Hong Kong university students, some of them under the watch of a CCTV camera, were the first to take compulsory courses on the territory’s national security law.

headline: Kaisa, units trading suspended as China property debt crisis routs developers' shares
text: HONG KONG/SHANGHAI, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Kaisa Group Holdings Ltd (1638.HK) and three of its units had their shares suspended from trading on Friday, a day after an affiliate missed a payment to onshore investors as China's snowballing property debt crisis jolts other developers.

headline: Jack Ma, Trump and Xi: How Chinese billionaire flew close to the sun
text: HONG KONG, Nov 5 (Reuters) - This was supposed to be Jack Ma's finest hour: a year ago to the day, his Ant Group was meant to go public in a $37 billion blaze of glory. Instead Beijing reined in his empire, abruptly clipping the wings of corporate China's biggest star.

headline: Visibility deteriorates as pollution cloaks China's capital
text: BEIJING, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Visibility in parts of Beijing was less than 200 metres (219 yards) on Friday as heavy pollution shrouded the Chinese capital, forcing the closure of some highways.

headline: Alibaba's Tsai says no plans to sell South China Morning Post - memo
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - Alibaba (9988.HK) has no plans to sell Hong Kong's South China Morning Post (SCMP), the e-commerce giant's co-founder Joe Tsai was quoted as saying in a letter to SCMP staff seen by Reuters, following a Bloomberg News report that a Chinese government-owned firm was weighing up an offer to buy the paper.

headline: Canada Goose eyes strong holiday season on China demand, supply chain strength
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - Canada Goose Holdings Inc (GOOS.TO) said on Friday it is eyeing a strong holiday season this year, as the winterwear maker benefits from surging demand for its luxury parkas in China and remains insulated from a global supply chain crunch across the sector.

headline: U.S. calls on China not to limit journalists' freedom at Winter Olympics
text: WASHINGTON, Nov 4 (Reuters) - The United States on Thursday urged China not to restrict access and movement for journalists reporting on next year's Winter Olympics in Beijing.

headline: Factbox: What are China's wealth management products?
text: SHANGHAI, Nov 5 (Reuters) - China's property sector woes have shed light on a unique off-balance-sheet funding source used by the industry called wealth management products (WMPs) and often sold to retail investors.

headline: Hong Kong markets watchdog says sees no systemic risk to city from China property turmoil
text: HONG KONG, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Hong Kong's Securities and Futures Commission has looked very closely at financial institutions in the city's exposure to China's troubled property sector and has not seen any systemic risks for the financial hub, the SFC's CEO told a media briefing Friday.

headline: Guangzhou, Shenzhen told to allocate 10% of land for affordable rental homes
text: BEIJING, Nov 5 (Reuters) - China's most populous province Guangdong said on Friday that its two biggest metropolises Guangzhou and Shenzhen must allocate at least 10% of their land for rental housing to meet rising demand for homes especially among the young.

headline: EXCLUSIVE Italy opens new probe into Boeing 787 parts supplier MPS -sources
text: BRINDISI, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Prosecutors in southern Italy have opened an investigation into the supply of parts to Boeing (BA.N) by Manufacturing Process Specification (MPS), a company at the centre of latest snags on the 787 Dreamliner, three people familiar with the matter said.

headline: BA-owner IAG optimistic on transatlantic reopening despite 2021 losses
text: LONDON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - British Airways owner IAG (ICAG.L) is "very optimistic" about the reopening of transatlantic travel and planning to ramp up capacity on those routes next year, fuelling recovery hopes despite warning of a big loss in 2021.

headline: Vietnam's Vietjet agrees deal with Airbus on plane delivery timings
text: Nov 6 (Reuters) - Vietnamese budget airline Vietjet Aviation JSC (VJC.HM) said it had signed an agreement with Airbus SE (AIR.PA) on Friday involving the timing of deliveries of 119 planes on order with the European manufacturer.

headline: Embraer sees return to positive cash flow, lifting shares
text: SAO PAULO, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Brazilian planemaker Embraer SA(EMBR3.SA)on Friday forecast positive annual cash flow for the first time since 2017, lifting its shares despite a third-quarter loss.

headline: Airbus shares fall 1% after lower Oct deliveries
text: PARIS, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Airbus (AIR.PA) shares slipped on Friday after the planemaker reported that October deliveries were down 10% from the previous month.

headline: U.S. airline disruptions cast a pall over holiday travel
text: CHICAGO, Nov 4 (Reuters) - A spate of high-profile flight cancellations has put a spotlight on worker shortages at U.S. airlines, triggering warnings of new delays over the holiday period as airlines scramble for staff.

headline: 'Bear of the Pyrenees', former Airbus CEO Jean Pierson dies
text: PARIS, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Jean Pierson, the "Bear of the Pyrenees" who propelled planemaker Airbus (AIR.PA) onto the global stage and began its transformation from a loose consortium into a European giant, has died, former colleagues said on Thursday.

headline: Qantas reports surge in domestic bookings as state borders open
text: SYDNEY, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Qantas Airways Ltd (QAN.AX) said on Friday it had taken nearly 500,000 domestic bookings in the past two weeks as states begin to open their borders, versus around 20,000 in a two-week period in August when parts of the country were locked down.

headline: Delta bookings soar in six weeks after U.S. move to open borders
text: Nov 4 (Reuters) - Delta Air Lines (DAL.N) has seen a 450% surge in international bookings in the six weeks since Sept. 20 when the United States said it would reopen for fully vaccinated visitors.

headline: Boeing shareholders reach settlement in 737 MAX board oversight suit - WSJ
text: Nov 4 (Reuters) - Boeing Co's (BA.N) current and former directors have reached an agreement of about $225 million to settle a shareholder lawsuit that claimed the plane maker's board failed to properly oversee safety matters related to the 737 MAX, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline: U.S. judge rejects Blue Origin challenge to NASA's pick of SpaceX moon lander
text: Nov 4 (Reuters) - A federal judge on Thursday rejected a lawsuit by Jeff Bezos' space company Blue Origin against the U.S. government over NASA's decision to award a $2.9 billion lunar lander contract to rival billionaire Elon Musk's SpaceX.

headline: American Airlines delays vaccine mandate until January next year
text: Nov 4 (Reuters) - American Airlines Group Inc (AAL.O) delayed the rollout of a mandate that requires its U.S.-based employees to be vaccinated against the coronavirus until Jan. 4, Chief Executive Doug Parker said in a letter to employees on Thursday.

headline: Boeing has 'more work to do', says U.S. air safety chief
text: WASHINGTON, Nov 3 (Reuters) - Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) chief Steve Dickson told a U.S. congressional panel that Boeing Co (BA.N) has "more work to do" as the planemaker continues to face scrutiny following two fatal 737 MAX crashes in the space of five months in 2018-2019 that killed 346 people.

headline: U.S. Senate panel plans airline oversight hearing after worker cuts
text: WASHINGTON, Nov 3 (Reuters) - The chair of the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee plans an oversight hearing on the airline industry after she asked the major carriers in July to explain worker shortages despite receiving billions in pandemic bailout.

headline: Nordic fund KLP excludes 14 weapons companies on ethical grounds
text: OSLO, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Norway's largest pension fund KLP said on Thursday it would no longer invest in 14 major weapons makers and their suppliers, including Raytheon Technologies Corporation (RTX.N) and Rolls-Royce (RR.L).

headline: Vietnam's Bamboo Airways signs 1.73 bln euro supply deal with GE, Safran JV
text: HANOI, Nov 3 (Reuters) - Vietnam's Bamboo Airways on Wednesday signed a memorandum of understanding with a joint venture between General Electric (GE.N) and Safran SA (SAF.PA) for the purchase of aircraft engines and equipment worth up to 1.73 billion euros ($2 billion).

headline: Airbus sees airlifter sales, warns on European drone autonomy
text: PARIS, Nov 3 (Reuters) - Airbus's (AIR.PA) new defence chief pointed on Wednesday to more sales of military transporters after deals in Kazakhstan and India and reaffirmed support for a new European fighter.

headline: Lufthansa flies back to black on cargo boom, easing travel curbs
text: BERLIN, Nov 3 (Reuters) - Germany's Lufthansa (LHAG.DE) expects high demand for its booming cargo business and the recovery of passenger flights to continue next year, it said on Wednesday, after reporting its first underlying operating profit since the coronavirus crisis.

headline: AirAsia interested in potential Airbus A321neo freighter
text: KUALA LUMPUR, Nov 3 (Reuters) - Malaysia's AirAsia Group Bhd (AIRA.KL) is in talks with Airbus SE (AIR.PA) about its interest in the manufacturer developing a new freighter version of its A321neo passenger plane, the head of its logistics arm said on Wednesday.

headline: Bollywood stars return to India's big screens after more than a year
text: MUMBAI, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Bollywood stars are returning to India's big screens after more than a year, with the film industry hoping that declining COVID-19 cases and the festival season will bring audiences back to the cinemas.

headline: Vivendi open to TIM's chairmanship role in boardroom war - sources
text: ROME, Nov 5 (Reuters) - France's Vivendi (VIV.PA) is open to the possibility of installing its CEO Arnaud de Puyfontaine as chairman of Telecom Italia (TIM) (TLIT.MI) in order to discuss with Italy's government ways to relaunch the phone group, sources said.

headline: Playboy settles trademark dispute over iconic bunny costumes
text: (Reuters) - Playboy Enterprises International Inc has settled its trademark case against  fast-fashion retailer Fashion Nova LLC, which it had accused of ripping off its "iconic" bunny costume, according to a filing in Los Angeles federal court.

headline: Investigations widen into deadly stampede at Houston rap concert
text: HOUSTON, Nov 7 (Reuters) - At least two investigations, one of them criminal, were underway on Sunday into the deadly stampede during rap star Travis Scott's Astroworld music festival that killed at least eight people and injured dozens in Houston.

headline: Factbox: Deadly Texas concert crush: who is Travis Scott and what is Astroworld?
text: Nov 6 (Reuters) - Travis Scott is a 30-year-old American rapper, singer and record producer from Houston, Texas, where at least 8 people were killed and many others injured in a crush at the opening night of his Astroworld music festival on Friday.

headline: Travis Scott's Astroworld concert pauses then restarts amid deaths, injuries
text: Nov 6 (Reuters) - Travis Scott's Astroworld concert on Friday was meant to signal the resurgence of his hometown with an epic live event after the global pandemic paused the popular annual hip hop festival.

headline: Analysis: Investors seek deep value in 'too cheap' telecom shares
text: Nov 4 (Reuters) - Some investors are scooping up shares of beaten-down telecommunication network stocks, betting that companies like AT&T and Verizon offer value despite cutthroat competition and muted prospects for revenue growth.

headline: Filming on 'Black Panther' sequel paused after Letitia Wright set injury
text: LOS ANGELES, Nov 5 (Reuters) - The sequel to Disney's "Black Panther" movie is shutting down production for at least a month to allow star Letitia Wright to recover from an injury, Hollywood publications reported on Friday.

headline: Telefonica swings to net profit but Spanish business wilts
text: MADRID, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Spanish telecoms firm Telefonica SA (TEF.MC) said on Thursday it swung to a net profit in the third quarter from a year-earlier loss thanks to the performance of its foreign units, though rising energy costs hit profitability in its domestic market.

headline: Deutsche Telekom announces $1 bln fibre optic deal with Australian investor
text: BERLIN, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Deutsche Telekom (DTEGn.DE) announced on Friday a fibre optic joint venture with Australian investor IFM, which will buy a 50% stake in the German telecommunications company's fibre optic unit GlasfaserPlus GmbH for 0.9 billion euros ($1.04 billion).

headline: Keep photos of our kids out of media, George Clooney pleads
text: LOS ANGELES, Nov 5 (Reuters) - George Clooney has appealed to news outlets to keep his children's faces out of the press, saying he fears that public photos would put their lives in jeopardy.

headline: Amazon seeks U.S. approval to deploy 4,500 additional satellites for internet project
text: WASHINGTON, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Amazon.com (AMZN.O) is seeking approval from U.S. communications regulators to deploy more than 4,500 additional satellites as part of the company's effort to deliver broadband internet to areas around the world that lack high-speed service.

headline: Brazil to reschedule auction for unsold 5G spectrum, minister says
text: SAO PAULO, Nov 5 (Reuters) - Brazilian Communications Minister Fabio Faria said on Friday that the government may schedule a new 5G spectrum auction to sell batches that did not attract interest, mainly in the 26 GHZ frequency.

headline: EXCLUSIVE Bain Capital-owned Brillio hires banks for IPO - sources
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - Private equity firm Bain Capital has kicked off preparations to list digital consulting firm Brillio on the U.S. stock market early next year, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

headline: Telecom giants shell out $1.27 bln in first day of Brazil's 5G auction
text: SAO PAULO, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Local units of America Movil, Telefonica, Telecom Italia and a number of local firms spent well over a billion dollars on Thursday in order to scoop up valuable spectrum dedicated to fifth-generation (5G) wireless technology in Brazil.

headline: AT&T, Verizon to delay C-Band spectrum use pending air safety review
text: WASHINGTON, Nov 4 (Reuters) - AT&T Inc (T.N) and Verizon Communications (VZ.N) said they had agreed to delay by a month the commercial launch of C-band wireless service pending an assessment of any impact on aviation safety technologies.

headline: TIM's asset revamp in focus as Vivendi challenges CEO -sources
text: MILAN, Nov 4 (Reuters) - A boardroom row at Telecom Italia pitting top investor Vivendi against CEO Luigi Gubitosi is escalating, two sources close to the matter said, raising the prospect of an overhaul of the Italian telecoms group's assets, including its fixed network.

headline: BT to go it alone on fibre build after costs fall
text: LONDON, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Britain's BT (BT.L) said it had decided not to bring in a partner to help fund fibre to an addition 5 million premises after a reduction in build costs and strong demand meant it stacked up for the company to invest all the money itself.

headline: MTN to sell shares in Nigeria unit via public offer
text: ABUJA, Nov 4 (Reuters) - MTN Group Ltd (MTNJ.J) will begin book-building this month for a public offer to sell up to 575 million shares in its Nigeria business, South Africa's biggest telecoms operator said on Thursday, as it reported higher third-quarter revenue and core profit.

headline: Sydney to further ease COVID-19 curbs on Monday as vaccinations pick up
text: Nov 7 (Reuters) - Australia's largest city of Sydney will further ease social distancing curbs on Monday, a month after emerging from a coronavirus lockdown that lasted nearly 100 days, as close to 90% of people have got both doses of vaccine, officials said.

headline: Austrian chancellor expects tighter COVID rules to remain past Christmas -newspaper
text: ZURICH, Nov 7 (Reuters) - Austria's latest measures to tackle the spread of coronavirus will likely stay in force over Christmas and New Year, Chancellor Alexander Schallenberg was quoted as saying on Sunday, as the country posted a record number of infections.

headline: Costa Rica issues COVID-19 vaccine requirement for children
text: SAN JOSE, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Costa Rican children aged five and up must get COVID-19 vaccinations, according to a new health ministry mandate, making the Central American country one of the first to adopt such a requirement for kids.

headline: S.Korea to purchase 70,000 courses of new Pfizer COVID-19 pill
text: SEOUL, Nov 6 (Reuters) - South Korea has agreed to buy 70,000 courses of Pfizer Inc's (PFE.N) experimental antiviral COVID-19 pill, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA) said on Saturday.

headline: U.S. administers 429.4 mln doses of COVID-19 vaccines –CDC
text: Nov 6 (Reuters) - The United States has administered 429,442,508 doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the country as of Saturday morning and distributed 533,019,545 doses, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

headline: New Zealand's daily coronavirus cases cross 200 for first time in pandemic
text: Nov 6 (Reuters) - New Zealand's 206 new daily community infections on Saturday carried it past the double-hundred mark for the first time during the coronavirus pandemic, as the nation scrambles to vaccinate its population of 5 million.

headline: China has given 75.96% of population complete COVID-19 vaccine doses
text: BEIJING, Nov 6 (Reuters) - China had given 1.072 billion people complete COVID-19 vaccine doses by Nov. 5, Mi Feng, spokesman at the National Health Commission, told a briefing on Saturday.

headline: Roche chairman sees greater flexibility after Novartis deal - paper
text: ZURICH, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Roche's (ROG.S) $20.7 billion move to buy back nearly a third of its voting stock from fellow Swiss drugmaker Novartis (NOVN.S) will give it more strategic flexibility, Chairman Christoph Franz said in an interview published on Saturday.

headline: Unvaccinated in Greece face new restrictions as COVID cases soar
text: ATHENS, Nov 6 (Reuters) - Queues formed outside shops in Athens on Saturday on the first day of new restrictions to curb soaring coronavirus infections which require the unvaccinated to have negative COVID-19 tests.

headline: Explainer: How does Merck's COVID-19 pill compare to Pfizer's?
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - Pfizer Inc (PFE.N) and Merck & Co Inc (MRK.N) have developed experimental antiviral pills that have shown promising efficacy in trials of adults with COVID-19 who are at high risk of serious illness. Both drugs also are being studied to see if they can prevent infection in people exposed to the virus.

headline: U.S. authorizes more batches of J&J COVID-19 vaccine made at Emergent
text: Nov 5 (Reuters) - The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday it had authorized the use of two more batches of Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ.N) one-dose COVID-19 vaccine manufactured at the problem-plagued Baltimore factory of Emergent BioSolutions Inc (EBS.N).

headline: Australia hits 'magnificent milestone' with 80% rate of vaccinations
